title: Crate
code:
-- Change the background to blue.
display.setDefault( "background", 0, 0.3, 0.8 )

-- Require and start the physics engine.
local physics = require("physics")
physics.start()
physics.setGravity( 0, 98.1 ) -- Setting a very high gravity.

-- Create a rock, the ground and the crate, and give them all physics bodies.
local rock = display.newImage( "images/rock.png", 510, 570 )
physics.addBody( rock, "static", { density=1, friction=0.9, bounce=0.1, shape={ -20,0, -3,-11, 3,-10, 20,0 } } )

local ground = display.newImage( "images/ground.png", 480, 608 )
physics.addBody( ground, "static", { density=1, friction=0.9, bounce=0.2 } )

local crate = display.newImage( "images/crate.png", 480, 100 )
physics.addBody( crate, "dynamic", { density=10, friction=2, bounce=0.2 } )
crate.angularDamping = 3
-- crate:setFillColor( 1, 0, 0 ) -- Uncomment this line to apply red tint to the crate.

-- Add two lines of text.
local text1 = display.newText( "Drag the crate with your mouse", 640, 30, native.systemFontBold, 40 )
local text2 = display.newText( "Or if you have other cool ideas, then try adding them!", 600, 64, native.systemFontBold, 20 )

local function dragCrate( event, params )
	local body = event.target
	local phase = event.phase
	local stage = display.getCurrentStage()

	if "began" == phase then
		stage:setFocus( body )
		body.isFocus = true
		body.tempJoint = physics.newJoint( "touch", body, event.x, event.y )

	elseif body.isFocus then
		if "moved" == phase then
			body.tempJoint:setTarget( event.x, event.y )

		elseif "ended" == phase or "cancelled" == phase then
			stage:setFocus( nil )
			body.isFocus = false	
			body.tempJoint:removeSelf()

		end
	end

	return true
end
crate:addEventListener( "touch", dragCrate )
